Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2023/0423 b) Date of Occurrence: 21/05/2023
c) Installation Details: Thunderhawk X-12 - AC-5847-691
at Sector North Station
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Armament b) Date Component 25/05/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Countermeasure Dispenser d) Main Assembly: Pylon-B
e) Nomenclature: Countermeasure Dispenser f) MOD Status: MOD-C
Assembly Unit
g) Part No.: AR-3598-J7 h) Sl No.: SN-3412-409
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 17/01/2020 l) Date of Removal: 22/05/2023
Pg No: 123 Ln No: 24 Pg No: 26 Ln No: 9
m) Manufacturing Agency: Elite Aerospace Solutions n) Date, Month & Year February 2017
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 3110 Hrs / 1287 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Safety Critical
b) Defect Observed: Ejector rack retention failure. Issue identified during pre-flight checks.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Corrosion due to moisture accumulation in sealed compartment
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Countermeasure Dispenser component.
Physical examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.
c) Remedial Measures Adjust calibration settings to manufacturer specifications
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Introduce protective coating to prevent environmental degradation
d) Attributable Code: N - Not established
Remarks: Thorough investigation completed. Preventive actions recommended.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions.
Date: 23/06/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality control procedures verified. Recommend periodic surveillance of manufacturing facility.
Date: 24/06/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Fleet experience reviewed. Similar occurrences noted on other platforms. Support fleet-wide inspection.
Date: 24/06/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
From quality standpoint, root cause analysis is thorough. Corrective measures are appropriate. Concur.
Date: 27/06/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Certification review completed. Proposed modifications do not affect type design approval. Acceptable.
Date: 01/07/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
